intro: Neobartsia jujuyensis, commonly known as the Jujuy devil's ivy, is a flowering plant native to the Andes of Argentina. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in spring. Neobartsia jujuyensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in rocky soils. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
